result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice

Defendant Joseph R Harris in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David Knaapen appears on behalf of Cass W Cousins for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM73 and 16CM85.

10:51 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM73:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM85:
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CM85 and Count 1 of 16CM73 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM73:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM85:
Count 2 -
5 day jail sentence 
4 day jail credit 
Time served sentence for good behavior
Pay $300 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Go to Clerk of Court's Office today to set up payment plan
Provide DNA sample
